Class QuestionTreeBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • QuestionTreeBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    QuestionTree

    public abstract class QuestionTreeBase
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class for maintaining the player's state in the 20 Questions Game, based on questions that have already been asked. The QuestionTree stores the possible objects in a tree indexed by their properties. Every internal node in the tree is a TreeNode and has a property as its value. Every leaf node is a LeafNode and has an object name as its value. Be sure to use the LeafNode class for objects to ensure that properties and objects do not get confused. As the game proceeds, parts of the tree are eliminated, allowing the player to eventually discover which is the chosen item.

    • Method Detail

      • buildTree

        public abstract void buildTree(java.util.ArrayList<QuestionObject> objects)
        This method builds the tree of objects.
        Parameters:
        objects - an array of QuestionObjects

      • findQuery

        public abstract Query findQuery()
        This method calculates the next question to ask in the game. It finds a node in the tree that has at least n/3 objects as descendants, and at most 2n/3 objects as descendants, where n is the total number of objects in the tree.
        Returns:
        the next query that eliminates at least n/3 objects in the tree

      • updateTree

        public void updateTree(Query query,
                       boolean answer)
        This method updates the tree based on the response to the query. If the query is satisfied (i.e., answer is true), then the m_searchRoot is updated to the matching node in the tree. Otherwise, the matching node in the tree is eliminated and the tree is re-trimmed.
        Parameters:
        query - the question that is asked
        answer - the answer to the query (true/false)

      • constructQuery

        protected Query constructQuery(TreeNode<java.lang.String> node)
        This method constructs a query based on the given node in the tree. If the chosen object satisfies the query, then it is guaranteed to be in the subtree of this node. If the chosen object does not satisfy the query, then it is guaranteed not to be in the subtree indicated by this node.
        Parameters:
        node - the node whose properties we want to turn into a query
        Returns:
        query associated with the node in the tree

      • countObjects

        public int countObjects()
        This method counts the number of objects that are descendents of a node.
        Returns:
        the number of objects in the tree

      • countObjects

        protected int countObjects(TreeNode<java.lang.String> node)
        This method counts the number of objects that are descendents of a node.
        Parameters:
        node - the root of the subtree
        Returns:
        the number of objects contained in the subtree

      • getOneObject

        public java.lang.String getOneObject()
        This method returns any one object from the tree. This is most useful if there is only one object left in the tree.
        Returns:
        any one object in the tree

      • getOneObject

        protected TreeNode<java.lang.String> getOneObject(TreeNode<java.lang.String> node)
        This method returns any one object from the tree. This is most useful if there is only one object left in the tree.
        Parameters:
        node - the root of the tree
        Returns:
        any one object from the tree

      • printTree

        public void printTree()
        This method prints all the objects in the tree, specifying the root-to-leaf path of each object.
